races.title: City Council - 2 Year Term
races.description: Seat vacated by Ann Pugh, who was appointed after Mike Scanlon resigned

candidates.name: Beth Zigmund
candidates.background: Cardiothoracic radiologist at UVM Medical Center and Associate Professor of Radiology at the Larner College of Medicine. Medical degree from Drexel University College of Medicine, radiology residency at Georgetown University Hospital, cardiothoracic fellowship at University of Pennsylvania Medical Center. Currently serves as Division Chief of Cardiothoracic Radiology and Director of Lung Cancer Screening at UVM Medical Center.
experience: Member of South Burlington Energy Committee (term expires 2027)
Co-Chair of Radiologists for a Sustainable Future
Volunteers with Citizens Climate Lobby and VT Climate and Health Alliance
Co-author of American College of Radiology Resolution on Climate Change and Sustainability
Member of ACR Task Force on Climate Change and Sustainability
Member of Association of University Radiologists Committee on Climate Change and Sustainability
Member of UVM Medical Center Sustainability Council

fiscalPolicy.title: Fiscal Policy & Taxes
fiscalPolicy.stance: Keep city taxes affordable through evidence-based decision making. Ensure new development pays its fair share so city services and taxes remain sustainable.

environment.title: Climate & Environment
environment.stance: South Burlington is already a national leader in climate action, but there is more to do. Continue reducing emissions while preparing for flooding, extreme weather, wildfire smoke and heat. Supporting resilience now is far more cost-effective than paying for damage later. Balance growth with protection of precious open spaces.

development.title: Growth & Development
development.stance: Evidence-driven approach that protects public health and quality of life for residents of all income levels. Develop a comprehensive growth-management plan addressing traffic, pollution, stormwater runoff, and infrastructure.

housing.title: Housing Affordability
housing.stance: Support practical zoning and development policies that increase the supply of middle- and lower-cost housing. Use up-to-date data to assess whether policies are truly lowering costs.

governance.title: Governance & Civic Engagement
governance.stance: Committed to respectful, productive civic dialogue. 'We can disagree without demeaning one another — and we must if we want durable solutions.' Protect constitutional rights and individual freedoms.

candidates.keyQuote: As a physician, I have spent my career listening carefully, weighing evidence, and working to help people find answers to and manage their health concerns.

civicRecord.action: Serves on South Burlington Energy Committee
civicRecord.context: Appointed member helping develop city climate and energy policy

civicRecord.action: Advocated for carbon-free construction ordinance at City Council
civicRecord.context: Urged councilors to pass the ordinance quickly, calling climate change 'the biggest human health crisis we're facing in the 21st century'

civicRecord.action: Testified at City Council on bedrock removal noise regulations
civicRecord.context: Spoke about 'excessive noise' affecting residents, urging stronger regulations

sources.title: VTDigger Commentary: EPA and Climate Policy

candidates.name: Amy Allen
candidates.background: Stay-at-home mom navigating 'sandwich generation' life — balancing raising children with elder care responsibilities. Before focusing on family, worked as an international development consultant for USAID and the World Bank across Latin America, East Africa, and Southeast Asia, specializing in government reform efforts including streamlining permit processes. Recently purchased 'forever home' in South Burlington after years of renting.
experience: Former international development consultant at USAID and World Bank
Specialized in government reform and permit process streamlining
Community volunteer (Green Up Day, scouting organizations)
Active in local civic engagement

fiscalPolicy.title: Fiscal Policy & Taxes
fiscalPolicy.stance: Ensure the economic development plan delivers real tax relief while addressing affordability challenges.

environment.title: Climate & Environment
environment.stance: Fund and fully implement the climate action plan while preserving Vermont's unique character.

development.title: Growth & Development
development.stance: Smart growth management positioning City Center as 'a gateway to Vermont.' Growth needs to be managed smartly so the community works for everyone.

housing.title: Housing Affordability
housing.stance: Address affordability challenges as part of broader economic development efforts.

governance.title: Governance & Civic Engagement
governance.stance: Ready to listen, cooperate, and work hard for a city where every resident can thrive. Believes in equitable access to government processes and transparency from political leaders.

candidates.keyQuote: A South Burlington for all is a future we can all agree on.
candidates.civicRecordNote: No prior South Burlington local government experience. Professional background is in international development consulting for USAID and World Bank, specializing in government reform and permit process streamlining.
